Maintenance work will close the road between pm on Monday and am on Tuesday.M westbound, junction -: The entry slip road of the M at junction  for Miskin will be closed overnight this week. Electrical work is being carried out on the section of road, forcing the westbound entry slip road to shut. Overnight closures will begin on Monday and run until Friday, with the road closed between pm and .am.M westbound, junction -: Surveys will close the exit slip road at junction  for Earlswood on the westbound M this week. The closure will take place on Tuesday night. With the exit shut between pm and am.M eastbound, junction -: The eastbound carriageway of the M will close on Tuesday night, between junction  for Capel Llanilltern and junction  for Coryton. Maintenance work will force the section of road to shut between pm on Tuesday and am on Wednesday.M westbound, junction -: The westbound carriageway between junction  for Coryton and junction  for Capel Llanilltern will also have to close overnight this week. title: monmouth schools named among best wales sunday times
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityThe Sunday Times has this morning published its Parent Power, The Sunday Times Schools Guide The th edition of the guide reveals highest-achieving schools in Wales and the UK, ranked by their examination results from -.Gwent schools named among best in WalesTwo Monmouth schools feature on the list of the top  independent secondary schools in the country.Both Monmouth School for Girlsand Monmouth School for Boysmake it onto the top ten in Wales.Almost three quarters of A-Level results at the girlsrsquo school ed results of A*-B, while . per cent of A-level results at the boysrsquo school hit that mark.Across the UK, Monmouth School for Girls ranked th for independent secondary schools, and Monmouth School for Boys ranked .Alastair McCall, editor of Parent Power, said: ldquoThe need for clarity about school examination performance has never been greater after two years of teacher assessed grades, during which for completely understandable reasons, the numbers of top grades increased dramatically.ldquoWe felt it was important to go back to the last sets of moderated public examination outcomes from ,  and  to get the most accurate and current view of school academic achievement. By taking a three-year average, we mitigated against relatively poor performance in a one-off year.ldquoAt a time when some schools are making hard to substantiate claims of academic prowess based on outcomes from  and , we believe these rankings ndash and all the additional information on offer in Parent Power ndash provide parents with a more reliable guide to academic achievement in schools today.Top  state secondary schools in WalesThese are the top  state secondary schools in Wales according to the Parent Power, The Sunday Times Schools Guide , and their rank among UK schools..removeTop  independent secondary schools in WalesAnd these are the top  independent secondary schools in Wales according to the Parent Power, The Sunday Times Schools Guide , and their rank among UK schools.The rankings in the secondary school league tables are determined by the average percentage of examination entries in the three years, -, gaining A* to B grades at A-leveland the average percentage of entries ing - or A* and A grades at GCSE.Only schools that published their results in those years or disclosed them to The Sunday Times have been included in this edition of The Sunday Times Schools Guide, which includes around , schools. Examination outcomes from  and  have not been used in determining this yearrsquos Parent Power rankings.The full Parent Power, The Sunday Times Schools Guide  is available online today, and as a supplement with The Sunday Times on Sunday, December . article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentComments: Our rulesWe want our comments to be a lively and valuable part of our community - a place where readers can debate and engage with the most important local issues. title: first case omicron coronavirus variant confirmed wales
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityA case of the Omicron iant of concern has been confirmed in the Cardf and Vale University Health Board area.It is being linked to international travel.The Welsh Government have said that they are prepared to "respond rapidly" to emerging iants of concern and that "intensive investigations and robust public health actionare being taken" to slow any spread.:"The health impact of the Omicron iant is still being assessed," said a spokesperson."Currently there is no substantial evidence to suggest the Omicron iant will lead to a more severe form of illness but the data is being kept under constant review."As we better understand this iant we will be able to determine the next steps."They stressed that, in the meantime, "sticking to the rules, following the steps which keep us safe and taking up the offer of a vaccine" continue to be the best way to protect ourselves and the NHS. article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentComments: Our rulesWe want our comments to be a lively and valuable part of our community - a place where readers can debate and engage with the most important local issues. title: travellers england face pre departure tests nigeria added red list
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityMr Javid said the Government had decided to move after receiving new data about the spread of the Omicron iant, which emerged in southern Africa.ldquoSince we have learned of this new iant our strategy has been to buy time. We have always said we will act swtly should new data require it, he told broadcasters.ldquoOver recent days we have learned of a signicant number of growing cases linked to travel with Nigeria.ldquoThere are  cases already in England and thatrsquos growing. Nigeria now is second only to South Africa in terms of linked cases to Omicron.The Department of Health and Social Carelater said the correct figure was .The Scottish and Welsh governments said they were both adopting similar controls.Under the new rules, from am on Monday only British and Irish nationals travelling from Nigeria will be allowed into the country and must isolate in a government-managed quarantine hotel.And from am on Tuesday, anyone travelling to the UK from countries not on the red list will be required to take a pre-departure test a maximum of  hours before leaving, regardless of their vaccination.And ndash from am Tuesday, anyone travelling to the UK from countries not on the Red List will be required to take a pre-departure test, regardless of their vaccination status.  mdash Sajid JavidDecember , The announcement will be seen as evidence of the mounting concern within Whitehall of the threat posed by the Omicron iant.However, the requirement for pre-departure tests was greeted with anger and dismay across the travel sector ndash just as bookings were picking up with the approach of the Christmas break.Tim Alderslade, chief executive of the industry body Airlines UK, said the rapidly changing measures meant planning for travel was becoming impossible..removeldquoIt is premature to hit millions of passengers and industry before we see the full data. We donrsquot have the clinical evidence, he said.Vaccines remain our first line of defence ndash the best way to protect yourself and your loved ones. Please get vaccinated or #GetBoosted as soon as you can.  mdash Sajid JavidDecember , ldquoTheyrsquove now changed their travel advice twice within a week and itrsquos just impossible for anyone to plan. These measures must be removed as quickly as possible in line with the speed of the booster programme.The Airport Operators Association chief executive Karen Dee said it was aldquodevastating blow for aviation and tourism, and said the Government should step in to support the industry. vw,vw,px, px"ldquoPre-departure tests acts as a major deterrent to travel and most of the limited remaining demand following the reintroduction of self-isolation will now fall away, just as airports were hoping for a small uplt over the Christmas holiday, she said.ldquoThe UK and devolved governments should have done the right thing and, alongside the restrictions, announced support for our businesses and our staff to get through another period of shutdown.The DHSC said new analysis by the UK Health and Security Agencysuggested the window between infection and infectiousness may be shorter for the Omicron iant, increasing the efficacy of pre-departure testing as it is more likely to identy positive cases before travel.For Labour, which has been calling for the re-introduction of pre-departure tests since the iant was identied, shadow home secretary Yvette Cooper welcomed the move but said ministers should have moved sooner.ldquoWe badly need them to learn the lessons on the importance of acting quickly on Covid border measures rather than each time having to be put under huge pressure to finally act.Nigeria joins  other African nations ndash Angola, Botswana, Eswatini, Lesotho, Malawi, Mozambique, Namibia, South Africa, Zambia and Zimbabwe ndash on the red list. vw,vw,px, px"Mr Javid however stressed the Government was still looking to the expanded vaccination programme as its main weapon in the fight against the spread of the disease.ldquoIt is important to remember while we are introducing these new border measures today vaccinations are our first line of defence The expansion of the booster programme is hugely important, he said.The HSA said that as of Saturday a further  cases of the Omicron iant have been reported across the UK ndash  of them in England.It takes the total number of confirmed cases of the iant in the UK to .On Friday the HSA said that in England Omicron cases have now been identied in East Midlands, East of England, London, North East, North West, South East, South West and West Midlands.Iniduals who have tested positive for the iant and their contacts are being asked to self-isolate while the HSA said it was carrying out targeted testing at locations where the positive cases were thought likely to be infectious.The figures came as a risk assessment by the HSA rated the Omicron iant as ldquored for severity of infection and ldquoamber for transmissibility between humans.It said the iant was likely to reduce the protection from both naturally or vaccine-acquired immunity.However it acknowledged there was so far ldquoinsufficient data to reach firm conclusions and the assessment was presented with ldquolow confidence.HSA chief executive Dr Jenny Harries said: ldquoWe are working as fast as possible to gather more evidence about any impact the new iant may have on severity of disease or vaccine effectiveness.ldquoUntil we have this evidence, we must exercise the highest level of caution in drawing conclusions about any signicant risks to peoplersquos health..push,i[r].l*new title: sir lewis hamilton nothing grenfell deal
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communitySir Lewis is competing with the team at the Saudi Arabian Grand Prix this weekend.Kingspanrsquos logo appeared on Sir Lewisrsquo car for the first time on Saturday.Speaking at a press conference after the qualying session, Sir Lewis said the decision had ldquonothing to do with him. vw,vw,px, px"Kingspanrsquos K insulation was one of the products installed on Grenfell Tower during its refurbishment ldquoIt is not something that I feel I have to speak about publicly, he said.ldquoI had nothing to do with the team signing any of the sponsors. Tommywas the only one I probably brought to the team.ldquoIt was news to me when I heard the things that have happened this week and I was very aware and watching closely all the families affected by what happened there.ldquoWe know there has been a huge outcry and an amazing amount of support by people in the community around there.ldquoIt is really nothing to do with me and I know Totois sorting it.ldquoUnfortunately my name is associated with it because it has been on my car but whether that remains the same, we will see.Sir Lewis has previously written about the Grenfell Tower fire on his Instagram account. vw,vw,px, px"Mercedes boss Toto Wolff apologised to Grenfell survivors and bereaved relatives over the deal In , he posted a picture with a caption that said: ldquoToday marks three years since the horric Grenfell Tower fire in London.ldquoRemembering the  souls we lost and their loved ones, and everyone affected by this tragedy.On Friday, Mercedes-AMG Petronas F team principal Toto Wolff apologised to Grenfell survivors and bereaved relatives, and thanked campaign group Grenfell United for an offer to meet following its condemnation of the deal with Kingspan..removeThe group had written to Mr Wolff urging him to end the deal.Responding to them in a letter, Mr Wolff wrote: ldquoThe tragedy of the Grenfell Tower fire was beyond imaginable to me, and it should never have happened.ldquoOn behalf of our team, I would sincerely like to apologise to you for the additional hurt that this announcement has caused.ldquoIt was never our intention to do so.ldquoThe work of the public inquiry to establish the full causes of the tragedy is crucially important.Mr Wolff said that before concluding the partnership, his team ldquoengaged with Kingspan in depth to understand what role their products played in what happened at Grenfell.He said: ldquoKingspan have stated that they played no role in the design or construction of the cladding system on Grenfell Tower, and that a small percentage of their product was used as a substitute without their knowledge in part of the system which was not compliant with building regulations and was unsafe. vw,vw,px, px"Grenfell survivors have asked Mercedes to end its sponsorship deal with Kingspan Meanwhile, Communities Secretary Michael Gove said the Government could amend advertising rules on racing carsMercedes does not pull the partnership with Kingspan.An inquiry is examining how Grenfell Tower came to be coated in flammable materials which contributed to the spread of flames, which shot up the tower in June , killing  people.Kingspanrsquos K insulation was one of the products installed on Grenfell Tower during its refurbishment, although the majority of the insulation used on the west London tower block was made by another company.In a statement released on Friday, Kingspan said it played no role in the design of Grenfell Towerrsquos cladding system.ldquoThe Grenfell Tower fire was a tragedy that should never have happened, and Kingspan supports the vitally important work of the inquiry to determine what went wrong and why, the company said.ldquoKingspan played no role in the design of the cladding system on Grenfell Tower, where its K product constituted approximately % of the insulation and was used as a substitute product without Kingspanrsquos knowledge in a system that was not compliant with the buildingrsquos regulations.ldquoThe new partnership with the Mercedes-AMG Petronas Formula One team reflects the ambitious sustainability targets of both title: heinz reveals terrys chocolate orange mayo can keep
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityThe unlikely partnership has released the "festive mash-up that you didnrsquot know you neededin the form of their Chocolate Orange Mayo.The new product has blended thefamily favourites together and is a mix ofmayonnaise and chocolate orange segments, creme patisserie and an extra dose of orange oil.The brands have suggested that the spread will work "perfectly dolloped onto your festive desserts or spread onto brioche, crumpets, pancakes, or croissants this festive season".How to getthe HeinzChocolate Orange MayonnaiseYou cant buy the spread but those brave enough to sample the new product can enter an exclusive competition.Heinz and Terrys are giving you the chance to win one of  jars until December .You can enter the competition via the Heinz to Home website.Heinz Chocolate Orange Mayo. Credit: Heinz PAHeinz sauces senior brand manager Maria Jantchi said: ldquoHere at Heinz, we are always innovating, and love creating fun new limited-edition products that we know our fans will love."So, this year we set out to create the most Christmassy mayo that we could think of.ldquoAnd who better to partner with for that than the iconic Terryrsquos Chocolate Orange, everyonersquos favourite Christmas treat ldquoAnd so, after months of development, we are absolutely delighted to be launching the worldrsquos first-ever Chocolate Orange Mayo, just in time for Christmas.Terryrsquos Chocolate Orange marketing controller Laure Gentil said: ldquoSince Terryrsquos Chocolate Orange launched in  we have never stopped innovating, growing, and launching new formats and flavours to delight our loyal fans, and we are proud to be continuing this Christmas with our mayo mash-up, which works perfectly as a delicious spread.Last month, Heinz launched its ldquoChristmas in a can which is a Christmas Dinner soup complete with turkey, Brussels sprouts and pigs in blankets..removeHeinz [Seriously] Good Terryrsquos Chocolate Orange Mayo is here! Would you try it  ##We have  #ChocOrangeMayos up for grabs, enter here - https:t.co ehufFMlQEOpen to UK residents +. One entry per person. Ends pm ... See link for full TCs. pic wDsByrXHxmdash HeinzDecember , The new product has not exactly been well received by fans.One user on Twitter quote tweeted the announcement, writing: "Is it really April st  Not December st  Not sure how we feel about this one... what about you Paired with a vomit green face emoji,another tweeted: "What in gods green earth is this ! title: new psm fund for greenway and active travel projects in ni welcomed
story: New rector at Kilmore is a familiar face   Canon Bertram Livingston - a man of deep faith who rose to the challenge of setting up a new church in s NI and had the respect of all faithsNewsTraffic and TravelCrimeWeatherPoliticsBusinessEducationHealthPeopleRead ThisCoronavirusSportFootballOther SportWhats OnArts and EntertainmentThings To DoHomes and GardensLestyleCarsHomes and GardensPublic NoticesAdvertise My BusinessFree Happy AdsNewsNew £m fund for greenway and active travel projects in NI welcomedA new £m fund for greenway and active travel projects is to be administered by councils across NI.By Carmel RobinsonFriday, rd December , : pm  "       "  SDLP Upper Bann MLA Dolores Kelly has welcomed extra funding which was announced by SDLP Infrastructure Minister Nichola Mallon on Tuesday last week. Armagh City, Banbridge and Craigavon will benefit from greenway works in Dromore and secure cycle parking, bike repair stands and cycle counters.Mrs Kelly said: “The announcement of an additional £m funding from SDLP Infrastructure Minister Nichola Mallon will benefit projects and people locally and across the North. Since becoming a minister, Nichola Mallon has made greenway and active travel projects a key priority for her and it’s great to see this delivery building on the success of other projects in this area. “In Upper Bann, cycle parking facilities and its usage have been generally very low but a large proportion are located on private land for customer use. However, the potential cycle parking solutions considered by Council offers a higher level of cycle parking given the visibility and security of the locations, followed by off street car parks, parks and then within the existing footways of the town centre. “The fact that SDLP Minister Mallon received more applications for funding than anticipated demonstrates the popularity of these projects and schemes across the North.“ The coronavirus pandemic highlighted the importance of having local greenways and outdoor spaces that people can enjoy and this funding commitment from the Minister will improve the lives of communities across the North. “The SDLP is determined to deliver the projects that matter to local people and I’m delighted to see SDLP Minister Mallon continue in this vein.” New hospital for Craigavon in limbo as Departments of Health and Finance wrangle over costEditor’s Message:Thank you for reading this article. We’re more reliant on your support than ever as the sht in consumer habits brought about by Coronavirus impacts our advertisers.Please consider purchasing a copy of the paper. You can also support trusted, fact-checked journalism by taking out a digital subscription of the News Letter.Nichola MallonSDLPCraigavonNorthDromore  "       "  Most PopularCraigavon woman Teresa Traynor hits the road as a big hearted Woman with a VanBilly Kennedy: My half century working in newspapersNew £m fund for greenway and active travel projects in NI welcomedCanon Bertram Livingston - a man of deep faith who rose to the challenge of setting up a new church in s NI and had the respect of all faithsPortadown killer Garfield Beattie, jailed for sending threatening letter to daughter of his murder victim, challenges  month sentenceMost PopularAppeal after burglary in LurganFour arrests after man stabbed in Portadown during mass brawl in People’s ParkFree parking plan for Christmas eventsRobinson to pay victims’ familiesGlamorous movie premiere for ‘A Christmas Dream’ filmed entirely in the Craigavon area                       This website and its associated newspaper are members of Independent Press Standards Organisation Follow us on    ExploreNewsSportWhats OnLestyleMore from Portadown TimesAnnouncementsJobsPublic NoticesMust ReadBuy a PhotoDirectoryUseful LinksContact UsAdvertise My BusinessAdvertise a JobPlace your AdSubscribeEventsArchiveReaders Charter " fill"#ea"  ©JPIMedia Publishing Ltd. ." target"_self" href"#" id"cookieSettings" class"sc-kTUwUJ sc-dqBHgY ciFbrr"Cookie SettingsTerms and ConditionsPrivacy policyModern Slavery Statement  News you can trust since News" class"expand" role"button" tabindex""  " "  "  scale translate " points"  .  . title: glamorous movie premiere for a christmas dream filmed entirely in the craigavon area
story: Man in hospital after two vehicle crash in Lurgan, Co Armagh   New jobs created as paint business expandsNewsTraffic and TravelCrimeWeatherPoliticsBusinessEducationHealthPeopleRead ThisCoronavirusSportFootballOther SportWhats OnArts and EntertainmentThings To DoHomes and GardensLestyleCarsHomes and GardensPublic NoticesAdvertise My BusinessFree Happy AdsNewsPeopleGlamorous movie premiere for ‘A Christmas Dream’ filmed entirely in the Craigavon areaAn exciting new Christmas movie, starring men, women and children from the Portadown, Craigavon and Lurgan areas, is to premiere next month.By Carmel RobinsonWednesday, th November , : am  "       "  Tickets are now on sale for the glamorous premiere of A Christmas Dream, the brainchild of veteran producer and director Kieran Corr.The Craigavon man is no stranger to treading the boards as Chairman of Moyraverty Arts and Drama Society but this is his first official juncture into the movie industry.Kieran, who can now add movie producer to his list of talents, revealed that they had just finished filming the final scene of A Christmas Dream.Some of the cast of the new movie A Christmas Dream produced by Moyraverty Arts and Drama Society in Craigavon.“The premiere is going to happen a week before Christmas and I would like to thank my co-writer Ellen Creaney for her input and advice. “In total we had over  people take part in the film. One of the youngest was Anna McGuinness who is only five and it included people of all ages. “I would like to thank our camera man Paul Heaney, choreographer Claire Louise Mooney and Jonny McGuinness who has written two original songs for the film and also composed the music. Many thanks to the entire cast and the MADS Committee for making this production possible. We now are all looking forward to seeing the film. “We filmed scenes at Cosy Coffee Lurgan, Cafe Vibe Lurgan, Shear Experience Lurgan, Perfect Day Lurgan, Lismore Comprehensive, Craigavon Civic Centre, Armagh Theatre, Kinnego Marina, Aine Mc Beauty Salon Carrigart, The Corner House Derrymacash, Miss Mac Dance Studio Lurgan and at the leading lady, Sophie Doyle’s own house. Sophie, Anna and Caitriona who are in the movie A Christmas Dream run by Moyraverty Arts and Drama Society in Craigavon.“The lead roles in the film was performed by Sophie Doyle from Aghagallon, a pupil of Our Lady’s Newry and Jake Watters from Lurgan who attends Lisburn Tech. Krise Hamill from Craigavon, Aimee Prigent from Lurgan, Maeve Scullion from Lurgan, Alana Cahoon from Portadown and Odhran Livingstone from Silverwood all perform key roles. “Sophie’s mother in the film was performed by Laura Haddock, a teacher at The Presentation PS, Portadown. Her dad was performed by Aaron Murphy, a teacher at St Brendan’s PS and her brother was performed by Fionn O Hagan who is a pupil at Lismore Comprehensive. We were delighted to involve all of MADS juniors in the film and this is a great opportunity for them all to perform in a Christmas film.” “The Premiere will take place on Saturday th December at Craigavon Civic and Conference Centre. Doors open at pm and the film will be shown at .pm. Due to restrictions a limited number of tickets. at £, are now available. This includes a wine reception for adults and juice and popcorn for children. It promises to be a perfect Christmas night out for the entire family. Kieran said: “This film is made in memory of my late brother The Very Rev Fr Tony Corr PP who died suddenly on June  this year aged .Jake Watters and Sophie Doyle who star in the movie A Christmas Dream produced by Moyraverty Arts and Drama Society.“He was my inspiration and support with this production. He helped me in what was a very dficult period in my le, fighting cancer, learning how to walk again and appreciating le. He read the first draft of the film and helped me make changes etc. “I owe him so much and miss him so much. The loss of Tony affected so many people. To everyone who knew Tony. you will all have your very own personal memories of Tony which will stay in our hearts forever. This film will certainly put a smile on my face every Christmas for as long as I live.” Tickets at www.ticketsource moyraverty-arts-and-drama-societyBus and police car collide at Christmas lights switch-on in PortadownEditor’s Message:Thank you for reading this article. title: junior reporter needed to interview the fureys
story: MPs back government’s ‘watered down’ plans on second jobs   Air Ambulance at ‘incident’ close to building siteNewsTraffic and TravelCrimeWeatherPoliticsBusinessEducationHealthPeopleRead ThisCoronavirusSportFootballOther SportWhats OnArts and EntertainmentThings To DoHomes and GardensLestyleCarsHomes and GardensPublic NoticesAdvertise My BusinessFree Happy AdsNewsPeopleJunior reporter needed to interview The FureysWe’re on the lookout for a junior reporter interested in the unique assignment of interviewing members of top Irish folk band, The Fureys.By Valerie MartinMonday, th November , : am  "       "  The Fureys, will be performing at the Waterfront Hall in Belfast on Saturday, January  and in advance of this showpiece event, we are giving one young person a unique opportunity to interview Eddie and George Furey from the band.The interview will take place at the Waterfront Hall in Belfast on Monday, December . Our junior reporter will have their showbiz interview scoop published across all of our Northern Ireland weekly newspapers.The junior reporter will also receive three tickets to see The Fureys in concert at the Waterfront Hall on Saturday January  and will write a review of the concert for our readers to enjoy.We are asking our readers to nominate a young person for this unique opportunity. Could your son, daughter, niece, nephew or grandchild fit the bill  Maybe you have a friend whose son or daughter would jump at this chance Our junior reporter will be aged approximately  - , with an interest in creative writing, English, media studies , and   or with an interest in journalism.They will prepare their own interview questions for The Fureys and write up theirinterview for their very own published feature exclusive.During their private audience with The Fureys, one of Ireland’s most famous music groups, our junior reporter will get the chance to uncover details of their amazing + year career, get an insight into their world tours, the amazing venues they have played in, what it was like to perform for the US President, how ex-PrimeMinister, Tony Blair, became a huge fan and much more. It will all be down to the questions our junior reporter asks!All you have to do to nominate a young person to be our junior reporter and interview The Fureys is tell us the name of the young person you wish to nominate and their relationship to you by the closing date of  noon on Monday, November . Email your entry by email to [email#protected] marking ‘The Fureys’ in the subject line. Please include your own name plus a contact phone number and email address where you can be reached.Please submit one question which the young person would like to ask The Fureys. All entries will be considered by a  of judges and the reader who has submitted the most interesting question will win the competition and be notied by us by Monday, November . A mutually suitable time for the interview at the Waterfront Hall on Monday, December  will be arranged. For tickets to see The Fureys at the Waterfront Hall in Belfast on Saturday, January , visit www.waterfront or phone   .Competition terms and conditions: Under s must be accompanied by a parent orto the Waterfront Hall on Monday, December  and any travel cost incurred will be at the accompanying adult’s expense.Normal JPIMedia competition rules apply, for more information go to: www.jpimedia competition.JPIMedia privacy Policy: https:www.jpimedia privacy-policyBelfastNorthern IrelandPresident  "       "  Most PopularCraigavon woman Teresa Traynor hits the road as a big hearted Woman with a VanBilly Kennedy: My half century working in newspapersNew £m fund for greenway and active travel projects in NI welcomedCanon Bertram Livingston - a man of deep faith who rose to the challenge of setting up a new church in s NI and had the respect of all faithsPortadown killer Garfield Beattie, jailed for sending threatening letter to daughter of his murder victim, challenges  month sentenceMost PopularAppeal after burglary in LurganFour arrests after man stabbed in Portadown during mass brawl in People’s ParkFree parking plan for Christmas eventsRobinson to pay victims’ familiesGlamorous movie premiere for ‘A Christmas Dream’ filmed entirely in the Craigavon area                       This website and its associated newspaper are members of Independent Press Standards Organisation Follow us on    ExploreNewsSportWhats OnLestyleMore from Portadown TimesAnnouncementsJobsPublic NoticesMust ReadBuy a PhotoDirectoryUseful LinksContact UsAdvertise My BusinessAdvertise a JobPlace your AdSubscribeEventsArchiveReaders Charter " fill"#ea"  ©JPIMedia Publishing Ltd. ." target"_self" href"#" id"cookieSettings" class"sc-dqBHgY sc-gxMtzJ bAegnq"Cookie SettingsTerms and ConditionsPrivacy policyModern Slavery Statement  News you can trust since News" class"expand" role"button" tabindex""  " "  "  scale translate " points"  .  . title: magical drive in movies as part of boroughs christmas celebrations
story: Free parking plan for Christmas events   Billy Kennedy: My half century working in newspapersNewsTraffic and TravelCrimeWeatherPoliticsBusinessEducationHealthPeopleRead ThisCoronavirusSportFootballOther SportWhats OnArts and EntertainmentThings To DoHomes and GardensLestyleCarsHomes and GardensPublic NoticesAdvertise My BusinessFree Happy AdsNewsPeopleMagical drive-in movies as part of borough’s Christmas celebrationsThis Christmas, Armagh City, Banbridge and Craigavon Borough Council has organised fun-filled, family friendly, Christmas Drive-In Movie events at eight venues across the borough.By The NewsroomWednesday, st December , : pm  "       "  It’s sure to be a truly magical movie experience for everyone. Film fans will be able to enjoy a range of yuletide classics such as Elf, The Polar Express, The Grinch and many others in the lead-up to the festive season.Passengers will enjoy the spectacular screenings on a giant LED screen, with sound transmitted via a dedicated FM radio station – in the comfort of their own car.Locations and dates for the Drive-In Movie events are:• Waringstown – Friday rd December• Rathfriland – Friday  th December• Richhill - Friday th December• Gilford – Saturday  th December• Keady – Saturday th December• Donaghcloney – Friday th December• Markethill – Friday th December• Tandragee – Saturday  th DecemberThere will be two movies shown in each area. Tickets are limited and booking is essential.Lord Mayor of Armagh City, Banbridge and Craigavon, Alderman Glenn Barr, comments: “We are thrilled to announce our exciting Drive-In Movie events with films to suit everyone this festive season! “It will be a fun-filled event for all ages, with a wide iety of classic and popular movies being screened. It’s the perfect event to keep the family entertained in the run-up to Christmas.“As always, we are committed to ensuring everyone has an excellent experience at the events whilst remaining safe and following all the government COVID- safety guidelines.”These events are free, however, booking is essential. Ticket availability will be released on the Council’s Facebook and Twitter pages – keep your eyes peeled for details.Ticket information and more details at www.lightupourborough drive-in-movies Editor’s message:Thank you for reading this article. title: major regeneration of silverwood golfski complex in lurgan out for consulation
story: Jake Bailey-Sloan: Lack of witnesses ‘hard to take’ says heartbroken father of popular Portadown murder victim   Portadown member of Glenanne Gang Garfield Beattie jailed for sending threatening letter to daughter of his murder victimNewsTraffic and TravelCrimeWeatherPoliticsBusinessEducationHealthPeopleRead ThisCoronavirusSportFootballOther SportWhats OnArts and EntertainmentThings To DoHomes and GardensLestyleCarsHomes and GardensPublic NoticesAdvertise My BusinessFree Happy AdsNewsPeopleMajor regeneration of Silverwood Golf Ski Complex in Lurgan out for consulationA major regeneration of Silverwood Golf Ski Complex is out for consultation, says Armagh, Banbridge and Craigavon Council.By Carmel RobinsonMonday, nd November , : pm  "       "  The project aims to look at ‘opportunities’ which will maintain the golf and ski complex and also new proposals which ‘will benefit and improve the health and wellbeing of the local community’.The Council says ‘all options’ will considered including ABC Council’s ‘ambitions to create a high quality visitor and leisure destination’.A spokesperson said: “Armagh City, Banbridge and Craigavon Borough Council has commenced a major regeneration project for Silverwood Golf and Leisure Complex, in Lurgan, as part of an initial consultation in relation to leisure and recreational investment in the area.Aerial shot of Silverwood Golf Club on the outskirts of Lurgan, Co Armagh.“The project aims to explore opportunities that will ensure access to high quality and publicly accessible recreational facilities at the site are maintained, and that any new proposals will benefit and improve the health and wellbeing of the local community.As part of this project an initial Expression Of Interestprocess has commenced, and provides an exciting opportunity for Silverwood, one that the Council hopes will attract inward investment and potential new developments for the area. All options will be considered by the Council with a view to providing sustainable Leisure and Recreational services and facilities to benefit the local community, staff and wider region into the future.Speaking about the potential regeneration plans the Lord Major of Armagh City, Banbridge and Craigavon Borough Council said: “The Silverwood area is well known for its outdoor leisure uses, with a long history of golfing, a ski centre and ancillary uses that the Council wishes to protect, support and sustain into the future. “Enabling this to happen will require the Council to undertake a major regeneration project at Silver Wood Golf and Leisure Complex, as part of a consultation in relation to leisure and recreational investment in the area. “In addition to the current service and facilities provision, there is the potential, subject to sensitive reconfiguring of the site, to incorporate new uses that complement those currently in place, and contribute to the Councils ambitions to create a high quality visitor and leisure destination based on the site and its surrounding assets”.EOI’s are sought for the potential use development of the site, to assist with the Council’s consideration of the options available and preparation of a forthcoming procurement exercise. If you would like further information or to discuss the EOI please contact Council at [email#protected] or the agent Lambert Smith Hampton on   . Jake Bailey-Sloan: Lack of witnesses ‘hard to take’ says heartbroken father of popular Portadown murder victimEditor’s Message:Thank you for reading this article.
